intro: Cosmos integrifolius, commonly known as the silky cosmos, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Mexico. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a prominent yellow center, blooming from midsummer to early fall. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves with a soft, velvety texture that gives it its common name. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Cosmos integrifolius is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
